description: Paddy is the unprocessed form of rice, grown in flooded fields. It is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population, especially in Asia.
A cereal grain which is a worldwide staple food. The most widely grown is common wheat, used for bread, pasta, and other flour-based products.
The edible berry of the plant Solanum lycopersicum. Widely used in Indian cuisine for its rich flavor and color in curries, sauces, and salads.
A starchy tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum. It is a root vegetable and the world's fourth-largest food crop, essential for many dishes.
The bulb onion is a vegetable and the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium. It is a fundamental ingredient in many cuisines worldwide.
The mung bean is a plant species in the legume family, cultivated for its edible seeds and sprouts. A primary source of protein in Indian vegetarian diets.
An edible fruit produced by an apple tree (Malus domestica). Apple trees are cultivated worldwide and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.
One of several vegetables in the species Brassica oleracea in the genus Brassica, which is in the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual plant that reproduces by seed.
A plant species in the nightshade family Solanaceae. Solanum melongena is grown worldwide for its edible fruit, a staple in dishes like Baingan Bharta.
A cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico. The leafy stalk of the plant produces pollen inflorescences and separate ovuliferous inflorescences called ears.
Mustard plants are any of several plant species in the genera Brassica and Sinapis in the family Brassicaceae. The seeds are used as a spice and for producing mustard oil.
